subject: Physical Fitness
title: Movement Quality
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Movement Quality.

hook.text: Perfect form doesn't exist. But there's a wide range between safe movement and movements that load tissues dangerously.

buildup.text: Movement quality means distributing force across the body, avoiding excessive stress on any single structure.

discovery.text: Good squat form distributes load across quads, glutes, and core. Poor form dumps it all on the lower back.

twist.text: Form doesn't need to be textbook â€” it needs to be appropriate for the load. Light loads tolerate more variation.

climax.text: As weight increases, form must tighten. The margin for error shrinks as load approaches your capacity.

punchline.text: Master movement light before lifting heavy. Form matters as load rises.

quiz.question: How does load affect the importance of movement form?
options: Higher loads require stricter form because the margin for error shrinks
Form doesn't matter at any load
Light loads require stricter form than heavy loads
